trans-unit.source: Provides a user interface for browsing the properties of an object.

To use the property grid, you create a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> class on a parent control and set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> to the object to display the properties for.
The information displayed in the grid is a snapshot of the properties at the time the object is assigned.

If a property value of the object specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> is changed in code at run time, the new value is not displayed until an action is taken in the grid that causes the grid to refresh.

The property tabs within the property grid appear as buttons on the toolbar at the top of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>, and can vary in scope as defined in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope>.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.LargeButtons%2A> property to display large buttons instead of the default smaller ones.
Large buttons are 32-by-32 pixels rather than the standard 16-by-16 pixels.
The large and small buttons and the property list expander icons (the plus or minus icons) are resized according to the system DPI setting when the app.config file contains the following entry:
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control is not initially presented in the toolbox in the development environment.
You can add a property grid to the toolbox, which enables you to drag a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> onto your form.
You can also define an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> by adding the appropriate code in your source code.
All public properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> will be displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> by default.

You can hide a property so that it is not displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control by decorating it with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> and setting the value to `false`.
You can specify the category that a property appears in by providing a category with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CategoryAttribute>.
You can provide descriptive text for your property that appears at the bottom of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control by using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DescriptionAttribute>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> class.
To populate the grid, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> property.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
`true` if enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the background color for the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the control.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.DefaultBackColor"></xref> property.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The background image of the property grid.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.BackgroundImage"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The background image layout of the property grid.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.BackgroundImageLayout"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the browsable attributes associated with the object that the property grid is attached to.
Only properties with attributes matching the values specified are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>.
The default is an <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> containing only <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Yes?displayProperty=fullName>.

Assigning an attribute collection that is empty or is `null` causes a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection> to be created with <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute.Yes?displayProperty=fullName> set.
The collection of browsable attributes associated with the object.
Gets a value indicating whether the commands pane can be made visible for the currently selected objects.
This property is `true` if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.CommandsVisibleIfAvailable%2A> is `true` and the object has commands available.
`true` if the commands pane can be made visible; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether OS-specific visual style glyphs are used for the expansion nodes in the grid area.
`true` to use the visual style glyphs; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the text color used for category headings.
The background color of category headings is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.LineColor%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure representing the text color.
Gets or sets the color of the line that separates categories in the grid area.
The color of the category splitter.
Collapses all the categories in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref>.
The method collapses the categories in the grid.
Those categories that have grid items in the category have a plus sign (+) displayed next to that category.
Gets or sets the color of active links in the executable commands region.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure representing the active link color.
Gets or sets the background color of the hot commands region.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for controls.
Gets or sets the color of the border surrounding the hot commands region.
The color of the commands border.
Gets or sets the unavailable link color for the executable commands region.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure representing the unavailable link color.
Gets or sets the foreground color for the hot commands region.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for control text.
Gets or sets the link color for the executable commands region.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> structure representing the link color for the executable commands region.
Gets a value indicating whether the commands pane is visible.
This property is `true` if the selected object has commands available and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.CommandsVisibleIfAvailable%2A> property is `true`.
`true` if the commands pane is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the commands pane is visible for objects that expose verbs.
`true` if the commands pane is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets the default location for the shortcut menu.
The shortcut menu location is the center of the active property label in the grid.
You can use this information to position the shortcut menu when the menu is invoked using the keyboard.
The default location for the shortcut menu if the command is invoked.
Typically, this is centered over the selected property.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The controls associated with the property grid.
When overridden in a derived class, enables the creation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref>.
See <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> for more information about creating property tabs.
The type of tab to create.
The newly created property tab.
Returns `null` in its default implementation.
Gets the default size of the control.
The default <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> of the control.
Gets the type of the default tab.
The default implementation of this property returns <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab>.
Override this property to specify a modified version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab>.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> representing the default tab.
Gets or sets the foreground color of disabled text in the grid area.
The foreground color of disabled items.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> so the memory it was occupying can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
Always call <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>.
Otherwise, the resources the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> is using will not be freed until garbage collection calls the destructor of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid>.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control paints its toolbar with flat buttons.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> paints its toolbar with flat buttons; otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Expands all the categories in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref>.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
The foreground color of the control.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.ForeColor"></xref> property changes.
This event is not relevant for this class.
Gets or sets the background color for the Help region.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for controls.
Gets or sets the color of the border surrounding the description pane.
The color of the help border.
Gets or sets the foreground color for the Help region.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for control text.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Help text is visible.
This property enables the display of any available Help text associated with the selected property in the grid.
`true` if the help text is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Occurs when a key is first pressed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when a key is pressed while the control has focus.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when a key is released while the control has focus.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether buttons appear in standard size or in large size.
You can use this property to enhance accessibility.
Large buttons are 32-by-32 pixels rather than the standard 16-by-16 pixels.
Both the large and small buttons are resized according to the system DPI setting when the app.config file contains the following entry:
`true` if buttons on the control appear large; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the color of the gridlines and borders.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for scroll bars.
Occurs when the user clicks the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> control with the mouse.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the mouse pointer moves over the control.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when the mouse pointer is over the control and the user releases a mouse button.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComponentModel.Com2Interop.IComPropertyBrowser.ComComponentNameChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.OnComComponentNameChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentRenameEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
This property is not relevant for this class.
This property is not relevant for this class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> value.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.Padding"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Processes a dialog key.
Specifies key codes and modifiers.
`true` if the key was processed by the control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the type of sorting the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> uses to display properties.
When you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> property, the appearance of the property sort buttons on the grid changes to reflect the current state of the property.

Setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort?displayProperty=fullName> causes the properties to be displayed in the order they were retrieved.

Setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> to both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort.Alphabetical> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort.Categorized> is the same as setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort.Categorized> alone.
The categorized view is always shown as alphabetical.
To do custom sorting, implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> on the component to return the properties in the desired order.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort.Categorized"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort.Alphabetical"></xref>.
The assigned value is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertySort"></xref> values.
Occurs when the sort mode is changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs when a property tab changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets the collection of property tabs that are displayed in the grid.
All property tabs derive from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> class.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertyTabCollection"></xref> containing the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> objects being displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref>.
Occurs when a property value changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls.
Refreshes the property tabs of the specified scope.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.RefreshTabs%2A> method first deletes the property tabs of the specified scope, it then requires the objects and documents to rebuild the tabs.
Either the `Component` or `Document` value of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyTabScope"></xref>.
The tabScope parameter is not the `Component` or `Document` value of .
Resets the selected property to its default value.
Typically, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.ResetSelectedProperty%2A> method is invoked by right clicking on the property.
This method discards changes and attempts to reset the property to its default value.
This method is not relevant for this class.
This method is not relevant for this class.
The horizontal scaling factor.
The vertical scaling factor.
Gets or sets the selected grid item.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridItem> corresponds to a property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A>.
You can use the returned <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridItem> to view type information, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>, the parent, and the children of the selected object.
The currently selected row in the property grid.
Occurs when the selected <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GridItem"></xref> is changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the background color of selected items that have the input focus.
The background color of focused, selected items.
Gets or sets the foreground color of selected items that have the input focus.
The foreground color of focused, selected items.
Gets or sets the object for which the grid displays properties.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> property sets a single object into the grid to be browsed.
If multiple objects are being browsed, this property returns the first one in the list.
If no objects are selected, `null` is returned.
The first object in the object list.
If there is no currently selected object the return is `null`.
Gets or sets the currently selected objects.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> only displays the properties that are common to all the objects that are in the array.
Assigning an array to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObjects%2A> replaces the reference to any <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObject%2A> you might make.
An array of type <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
The default is an empty array.
One of the items in the array of objects had a null value.
Occurs when the objects selected by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.SelectedObjects"></xref> property have changed.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets the currently selected property tab.
All property tabs derive from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.PropertyTab"></xref> that is providing the selected view.
Displays or hides the events button.
`true` to show the events button; `false` to hide the events button.
Gets a value indicating whether the control should display focus rectangles.
`true` if the control should display focus rectangles; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the image that represents the property page.
The image that represents the property page.
Gets or sets the site of the control.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> associated with the Control, if any.
Gets the image that represents sorting grid items by category.
The image that represents sorting by category.
Gets the image that represents sorting grid items by property name.
The image that represents sorting by property.
Gets or sets the text associated with this control.
The text associated with this control.
Occurs when the text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref> changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the toolbar is visible.
`true` if the toolbar is visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets the painting functionality for <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref> objects.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid"></xref>.

Gets or sets a value that determines whether to use the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> class ([!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)]) or the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer"></xref> class ([!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)]) to render text.

The `UseCompatibleTextRendering` property is intended to provide visual compatibility between Windows Forms controls that render text using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> class and [!INCLUDE[net_v10_short](~/includes/net-v10-short-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[net_v11_short](~/includes/net-v11-short-md.md)] applications that perform custom text rendering using the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class.

In most cases, if your application is not being upgraded from [!INCLUDE[net_v10_short](~/includes/net-v10-short-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[net_v11_short](~/includes/net-v11-short-md.md)], it is recommended that you leave `UseCompatibleTextRendering` set to the default value of `false`.

The [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] based <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> class was introduced in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnlong](~/includes/dnprdnlong-md.md)] to improve performance, make text look better, and improve support for international fonts.

In earlier versions of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] based <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class was used to perform all text rendering.
[!INCLUDE[ndptecgdi](~/includes/ndptecgdi-md.md)] calculates character spacing and word wrapping differently from [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)].

In a Windows Forms application that uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> class to render text, this could cause the text for controls that use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextRenderer> to appear different from the other text in the application.
To resolve this incompatibility, you can set the `UseCompatibleTextRendering` property to `true` for a specific control.

To set `UseCompatibleTextRendering` to `true` for all supported controls in the application, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.SetCompatibleTextRenderingDefault%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with a parameter of `true`.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> class should be used to perform text rendering for compatibility with versions 1.0 and 1.1.
of the .NET Framework; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating the background color in the grid.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is the default system color for windows.
Gets or sets the color of the border surrounding the grid area.
The color of the property grid border.
Gets or sets a value indicating the color of the text in the grid.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> values.
The default is current system color for text in windows.
Processes Windows messages.
The Windows <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> to process.

[!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)] saves some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid> control states, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.PropertySort%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PropertyGrid.HelpVisible%2A> properties, to the registry and loads them the next time the user runs the application.
